report_title: Plastic Pipe & Parts Manufacturing in the US
executive_summary: Over the past five years, the performance of the Plastic Pipe and Parts Manufacturing industry mirrored the volatile economic conditions in the United States. This industry offers a wide range of plastic pipes and profiling shapes like tubes, rods and car components. Plastic pipes, especially polyvinyl chloride (PVC) pipes, are used to construct new homes, while other plastic profile shapes, like plastic rods and tubes, are used in automobile production. New changes in the manufacturing of plastic pipes have enabled them to handle higher pressures and temperatures, expanding their use in industrial manufacturing, oil and gas and pressurized water supply applications.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: A diverse customer base has kept the industry afloat
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Even as industry manufacturers suffered significant losses during the COVID-19 pandemic, the presence of a diverse customer base helped the industry escape major losses.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Hearty performance of downstream markets strengthen the industry's resolve
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: In recent years, one of the silver linings for industry manufacturers is the strong relationship fostered between the industry and the industrial manufacturing sector.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Technological innovation advances industry's commodity influence
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: The industry produces plastic parts by heating up resins and placing them into an extrusion machine. This simplified production process has made the industry an attractive alternative to alterative commodities.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Rebounding economy following the pandemic will renew downstream demand, boosting industry growth
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: As the broader economy continues to recover following the COVID-19 pandemic and rapid inflation in 2023, the industry will benefit from the stabilization of core sectors like construction and manufacturing.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Rising inflationary pressures will dampen revenue growth for the industry
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Although the reopening of the economy will help industry manufacturers secure pent-up demand from downstream markets, the acceleration of inflationary pressures will dampen revenue growth.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Expansion of the industry's research and development strengthens competitive commodity position
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: A key development for manufacturers moving forward is the constant activity in research and development across the industry.

industry_definition: This industry manufactures a range of plastic pipes, plastic fittings for plastic pipes and unlaminated plastic profile shapes, such as rods, tubes, plates and car parts. It does not include plastic hose fixtures, plastic plumbing fixtures or plastic packaging.
key_trends: Heightened internal competition is fueled by diverse customer base.
High import penetration accelerates external competition.
The industry rebounded from the COVID-19 pandemic in force.
Volatility in the price of plastic materials and resin influences industry strategy.
Three companies own more than a 5.0% share of the market.
Acceleration of improved production facilities strengthens market share for established companies.
Companies face more difficulty capturing a larger market share due to higher capital requirements for efficient machinery, which benefits established companies.
Dependence on plastic materials and resin has impacted industry growth.
A notable regulatory landscape creates additional compliance costs for industry manufacturers.
Volatile industry profit is affected by commodity prices.
Consistent worker demand maintains stable wage costs.
Regions with large population centers will be more attractive industry destinations.
Enhanced manufacturing presence benefits industry presence.

market_segmentation.segment_description: Construction industry focus leading to steady demand.
Critical sector for plastic pipe applications.
Infrastructure sector requiring extensive piping solutions.

products_and_services.product_or_service: Unlaminated Plastic Profile Extrusions and Shapes
products_and_services.product_description: Plastic extrusions used in various industries.

products_and_services.product_or_service: Sewer, Storm Drain and Other Nonpressurized Water Pipes
products_and_services.product_description: Essential for municipal and residential water management.

products_and_services.product_or_service: PIPES FOR INDUSTRIAL AND MINING APPLICATIONS
products_and_services.product_description: High-strength pipes suitable for industrial use.
Specialized pipes for the oil and gas sector.

tier_1_suppliers: Plastic & Resin Manufacturing in the US
Industrial Machinery & Equipment Wholesaling in the US
Inorganic Chemical Manufacturing in the US
Organic Chemical Manufacturing in the US
Plastics & Rubber Machinery Manufacturing in the US
tier_1_buyers: Construction & Mining Equipment Wholesaling in the US

demand_determinants.determinant_description: The Plastic Pipe and Parts Manufacturing industry's primary downstream market. Plastic pipes, hoses and fittings are used in residential, commercial, industrial and public works construction projects.

international_trade_points.trade_title: STRONG PERFORMANCE OF US DOLLAR MAINTAINS COLLECTIVE IMPORTS STRENGTH
international_trade_points.trade_description: A core accelerant that enabled strong import penetration for the industry is a strong US dollar, as exemplified by the Trade-Weighted Index (TWI).

international_trade_points.trade_title: VOLATILE INPUT COSTS OF PLASTIC MATERIALS AND RESIN ENCOURAGE IMPORT PENETRATION
international_trade_points.trade_description: With core input costs enduring volatility during the COVID-19 pandemic, the industry continues to rely on broad importation as a means of lowering purchase costs and stabilizing profitability.

international_trade_points.trade_title: Expansion of Free Trade Enhances Exports Patterns Within the Industry
international_trade_points.trade_description: With Canada and Mexico serving as the largest export markets for industry manufacturers, the embrace of free trade bolsters export trends across the industry.

international_trade_points.trade_title: Growing International Markets Influences Exports Appeal for the Industry
international_trade_points.trade_description: The growth of international manufacturing markets that produce plastic pipes and parts at less expensive prices provides the industry with appealing options to expand globally.

business_locations.location_description: As a region with a large population concentration and a constant demand for plastic pipes and parts, the Southeast remains the region with the strongest industry presence.
Since the industry does business with many manufacturing companies, many industry establishments have found a convenient home in the Great Lakes due to a compact manufacturing presence.

Industry establishments benefit from favorable geographic and population factors in the West, as the region is home to core customers like oil and gas refineries while also possessing consistent weather year-round.
The Southwest has many similarly favorable characteristics with the Western region, as it also has compact geography and a robust presence of oil and gas refineries.

Although the Mid-Atlantic lacks the scope of oil and gas refineries compared with other regions, large metropolitan centers in states like New York provide industry establishments with proximity to a diverse array of customers.

regulations_points.regulation_description: Industry manufacturers must comply with various engineering standards from organizations like the American Society for Testing Materials, American Water Works Association and Underwriter's Laboratory.
In 2018, the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration (PHMSA) amended its federal regulation regarding plastic pipes to enhance pipeline safety.

Most plastic composites manufacturing operations generate some emissions of hazardous air pollutants (HAPs) during the application and curing of thermoset resins, particularly composite products with polyester and vinyl ester resins and gel coats.
The industry manages multiple regulations surrounding chemical usage. In 2016, The Toxic Substance Control Act (TSCA) of 1976, was updated with new regulations regarding chemicals.

barriers_points.barrier_description: The industry has high revenue volatility.
The industry has high and steady competition.

basis_points.basis_description: Heightened internal competition is fueled by diverse customer base.
High import penetration accelerates external competition.
The industry faces higher competition from product substitutes and foreign competitors.

concentration_points.concentration_description: Diversified customer stream creates advantage for new entrants looking to grow in the industry.
High operating costs leave little room for error across the industry.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Wide Scope of Demand for Labor Fuels Wage Costs for the Industry
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Industry manufacturers rely extensively on labor to research, develop, produce, package, market and sell the industry's wide array of plastic pipes and parts to respective customers.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Extensive Emphasis on Raw Materials Creates Expensive Purchase Costs for Industry Manufacturers
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: One of the largest expenditures for any industry manufacturers is the acquisition of raw materials for the production of plastic parts and pipes.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: Despite the industry's notable labor costs, there is a higher level of capital intensity due to large capital costs of acquiring, maintaining and updating manufacturing equipment.

volatility_points.volatility_title: Moderate volatility due to uncertain economic sentiment
volatility_points.volatility_description: The industry's reliance on economic stability both within commodity prices and among core customers makes the industry prone to setbacks whenever economic stability hits the markets.

volatility_points.volatility_title: Volatility among commodities complicates business model for the industry
volatility_points.volatility_description: A core roadblock to lower industry volatility is the constant dependence on stable commodity prices, with industry manufacturers in constant demand for plastic materials and resin to produce plastic goods.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: Advancement in Extrusion Technology Improves Pipe Production Process
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: One of the core advancements in recent years has been the expansion of automated technology used within extrusion machinery and the broader extrusion process.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: Improved Quality of PVC Pipes Enhances Product Reputation Among Core Customers
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: The industry also benefited from upgrades in the pipes themselves, with newer models of PVC pipes a core component of this innovation.

FAQs.question: Recycling Regulations
FAQs.answer: Recycling legislation requiring that a certain percentage of recycled plastic be included in a specified amount of new plastic containers has been enacted in several states. Since the price of recycled resin is currently lower than the price of virgin resin, it is unclear how these regulations will affect the cost of production.

FAQs.question: Industry Assistance
FAQs.answer: Industry manufacturers benefit primarily from the assistance of several private trade associations at the national and regional levels. Significant trade associations include the Society of the Plastics Industry, the Plastics Pipe Institute, American Water Works Association, the American Public Works Association and the Plastic Pipe and Fittings Association. These associations assist members with workplace development programs, compliance assistance, trade shows, industry information and statistics, safety and environmental programs.

FAQs.question: Are your company's sales heavily dependent on the health of the US economy?
FAQs.answer: Demand for industry products is heavily linked with activity in the construction and industrial manufacturing markets. When the US economy is growing, these markets typically increase production, which in turn leads to increased demand for industry products. Amidst an increasingly hawkish Federal Reserve, demand for industry products have stagnated recently due to higher borrowing costs for the industry's industrial and nonresidential market segments. Residential housing markets, however, have so far been resistant to large-scale declines despite the interest rate increases; uncertainty does exist within this market down the road, though.

FAQs.question: Does your company specialize in a niche or do you produce a diversified range of products?
FAQs.answer: Manufacturers in the plastic pipe and parts industry produce a diversified range of products. These products vary by the type of plastic materials and resins used in the production of the pipes and parts, as well as the application for them.

FAQs.question: Is your company investing heavily in R&D to meet changing consumer preferences?
FAQs.answer: Manufacturers have been investing in R&D to create low-cost, long-lasting products in order to compete with metal and concrete alternatives.

FAQs.question: Has your company been exposed to volatile input prices over the past few years?
FAQs.answer: Manufacturers are directly affected by the price of plastic materials and resin. The price of plastic materials and resin has increased in recent years as highly volatile crude oil prices coupled with supply chain issues created a wave of volatility within the larger domestic market. Manufacturers are unable to pass off highly increased costs to customers, affecting profitability.

FAQs.question: Have you been able to reduce wage costs through automation over the past five years?
FAQs.answer: Wage costs have been relatively stable over the past five years, as there has been volatile levels of demand for industry products, which, in turn, has created different wage costs for multiple industry operators.

FAQs.question: How do technological changes in downstream markets affect industry products?
FAQs.answer: To meet the demands of downstream markets, manufacturers will modify the way they manufacture plastic products in order to best fit client usage.

FAQs.question: Do you work with trade associations or other interest groups to advance your company's interests?
FAQs.answer: The Plastics Pipe Institute was established nearly 60 years ago and has over 300 members. The association aims to advance the use of plastic piping as opposed to substitute goods.

FAQs.question: How often does your company purchase new equipment?
FAQs.answer: When manufacturers need to make capital expenditures it is typically very expensive.

FAQs.question: How does your company's profit compare with your main competitors'?
FAQs.answer: Comparison between manufacturers in the industry and their competitors depends on the products they manufacture, the size of their operations and the clients they serve. Input prices for raw materials like ferrous and nonferrous metals influence the profit of metal pipe manufacturers, the industry's main competitor.

FAQs.question: Developing new products
FAQs.answer: Research and development enables companies to develop new products and niche markets, giving them a competitive edge over other industry players.

FAQs.question: Supply contracts
FAQs.answer: A reliable supply of key inputs, like resin, at a competitive cost, increases the company's profitability. A supply contract fixes the price of the company's inputs, allowing it to be more price-competitive. With recent supply chain issues globally, it's important for the supply contracts to be able to avoid the current inflated prices and secure a solid price point in order to avoid eating into profitability.

FAQs.question: How can you make your manufacturing processes more efficient? What supply chain efficiencies can you establish?
FAQs.answer: The development of large-scale production facilities enables companies to increase their profitability through the achievement of lower per-unit production costs. Increased levels of domestic manufacturing will result in less demand for exports for domestic producers and improve efficiency in transporting the goods both domestically and globally.

FAQs.question: How much of your business comes from the automotive sector? Can you diversify your client base to shore up losses in this area?
FAQs.answer: The automotive industry uses plastic profiles for interior trim and includes plastic piping and parts as components and connectors in the automobile.

FAQs.question: Do you do much business with downstream water and irrigation businesses? How do you plan to mitigate the threat of declining demand?
FAQs.answer: An hike in demand for water supply, sewerage and drainage services causes demand for these products to expand.

FAQs.question: What share of your products are used in construction? How can you establish more downstream connections in this growing market?
FAQs.answer: An increase in the level of construction activity causes demand for plastic pipe products to rise.

FAQs.question: As environmental sustainability becomes more critical, plastic pipe manufacturers are developing more ecologically friendly products that contribute to energy efficiency, like pipes for geothermal heating systems.
FAQs.answer: Some companies are investing in sustainable practices and eco-friendly alternatives.
